Description: Wall sherd of Aeolian grey ware pottery vessel, possibly a krater or hydria; interior reserved; exterior: very worn dark grey slip; decoration in relief consisting of tendril and dot; circular pattern next to tendril from palmette decoration now lost. Drill holes for analysis.
Curator's comments: The sherd probably belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1888,0601.644.c and 1888,0601.644.k. 1888,0601.644.c was analysed with NAA by Hans Mommsen (Bonn). The origin of the fabric (NAUK 47) was not identified and considered a chemical singleton. Schlotzhauer points out that similar palmette decoration is not uncommon on East Greek wares, notably on Fikellura amphora and that grey wares were popular in North Ionia and Aeolis.
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 075)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GL.125)
